sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using QR decomposition:

x + 2y - z = 1  
2x + 3y + z = 3  
3x + 5y + 4z = 5
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to represent the system in matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 1  2 -1 |
    | 2  3  1 |
    | 3  5  4 |

b = | 1 |
    | 3 |
    | 5 |

Now, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, which means we factor A into the product of an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthogonal matrix Q and the upper triangular matrix R.

q1 = a1 / ||a1|| = (1, 2, 3) / sqrt(14)
q1 = (1/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 3/sqrt(14))

a2' = a2 - (a2.q1)q1
a2' = (2, 3, 5) - (20/sqrt(14))(1/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 3/sqrt(14))
a2' = (2, 3, 5) - (10/7, 20/7, 30/7)
a2' = (-3/7, 1/7, 5/7)

q2 = a2' / ||a2'|| = (-3/7, 1/7, 5/7) / sqrt(35/49)
q2 = (-3/sqrt(35), 1/sqrt(35), 5/sqrt(35))

a3' = a3 - (a3.q1)q1 - (a3.q2)q2
a3' = (-1, 1, 4) - (11/sqrt(14))(1/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 3/sqrt(14)) - (2/sqrt(35))(-3/sqrt(35), 1/sqrt(35), 5/sqrt(35))
a3' = (-1, 1, 4) - (11/14, 22/14, 33/14) - (-6/35, 2/35, 10/35)
a3' = (0, 0, 1/35)

q3 = a3' / ||a3'|| = (0, 0, 1/35) / sqrt(1/1225)
q3 = (0, 0, 1/5)

Now we have the orthogonal matrix Q:

Q = | 1/sqrt(14) -3/sqrt(35)  0 |
    | 2/sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(35)  0 |
    | 3/sqrt(14)  5/sqrt(35)  1/5 |

And the upper triangular matrix R:

R = | sqrt(14) 20/sqrt(14) 11/sqrt(14) |
    |   0      sqrt(35/7)  2/sqrt(35)  |
    |   0         0         1/5         |

Now we need to solve the system Rx = Q^Tb.

Q^T = | 1/sqrt(14)  2/sqrt(14)  3/sqrt(14) |
      | -3/sqrt(35) 1/sqrt(35)  5/sqrt(35) |
      |     0          0         1/5        |

Q^Tb = | 1/sqrt(14) + 6/sqrt(14) + 15/sqrt(14) |
       | -3/sqrt(35) + 3/sqrt(35) + 25/sqrt(35) |
       |                   1                     |

Q^Tb = | 22/sqrt(14) |
       | 25/sqrt(35) |
       |      1       |

Now we solve the upper triangular system Rx = Q^Tb using back-substitution:

R = | sqrt(14) 20/sqrt(14) 11/sqrt(14) |   x = | x1 |   Q^Tb = | 22/sqrt(14) |
    |   0      sqrt(35/7)  2/sqrt(35)  |       | x2 |          | 25/sqrt(35) |
    |   0         0         1/5         |       | x3 |          |      1      |

From the last row of R: 
x3 = 1 / (1/5) = 5

From the second row of R:
x2 = (25/sqrt(35) - 2/sqrt(35) * 5) / sqrt(35/7) = 5/sqrt(35)

From the first row of R:
x1 = (22/sqrt(14) - 20/sqrt(14) * 5/sqrt(35) - 11/sqrt(14) * 5) / sqrt(14) = -3/sqrt(14)

So the solution to the system is:

x1 = -3/sqrt(14)
x2 = 5/sqrt(35)
x3 = 5
